definition: to escape without trace (idiom); to make one's getaway (from the scene of a crime)/to show a clean pair of heels
variant of 夭[yao1]/to die young/to die prematurely/Taiwan pr. [yao3]
variant of 夭[yao1]/to die young/to die prematurely/Taiwan pr. [yao3]

sentences.english: It’s as if problems and challenges run from the person who has confidence.
sentences.chinese: 问题和挑战仿佛从自信者身上逃之夭夭。

sentences.english: They had already escaped away with jewelries worth thousands of pounds.
sentences.chinese: 他们已经带着价值数千镑的首饰逃之夭夭了。

sentences.english: A lorry ran over Jane's cat and sped away.
sentences.chinese: 一辆卡车从简的猫咪身上碾过后逃之夭夭。

sentences.english: The thief got away, but not without some scratches and bruises.
sentences.chinese: 小偷带着浑身的抓痕和青肿逃之夭夭。

sentences.english: While in flames, he grabbed a roll of lottery tickets and fled.
sentences.chinese: 火烧火燎中，他抓了了一卷彩票逃之夭夭。

sentences.english: But one set of words that I hear at mixers and networking events makes me really want to run for the hills.
sentences.chinese: 但从交友活动中听到的一些话让我真想逃之夭夭。

sentences.english: In case of danger, it will eject ink out, then decamp.
sentences.chinese: 假若遇到危险，它会喷出墨汁出来，然后逃之夭夭。

sentences.english: So strange fish a go into behind water tail a put to flee.
sentences.chinese: 所以怪鱼一入水后尾巴一摆逃之夭夭。

sentences.english: But he escaped and got off scot-free.
sentences.chinese: 不过，他逃之夭夭，没有受到惩罚。

sentences.english: Rauf later escaped from Pakistani custody.
sentences.chinese: 拉乌夫后来从巴基斯坦的看管之下逃之夭夭。

sentences.english: Philosophy pursues with its glance, probes the evil, and does not permit it to escape into nothingness.
sentences.chinese: 哲学用正直的目光追踪罪恶，决不允许它逃之夭夭。

sentences.english: And when everything is perfect, you escape such as thieves…
sentences.chinese: 诸事顺遂之时，如贼首般逃之夭夭。

sentences.english: The black ox has trampled on them. Two robbers killed all family members and ran away.
sentences.chinese: 倒霉鬼光顾他们，两名强盗杀了全家后便逃之夭夭了。

sentences.english: As Yoda used the Force to save his fellow Jedi, Dooku fled.
sentences.chinese: 当尤达使用原力拯救他的绝地同伴时，杜库逃之夭夭。

sentences.english: The boy clutched the marbles and ran away.
sentences.chinese: 那男孩一把抢去弹珠便逃之夭夭。

definition: to leave in stealth/to slip away
to flee from sth/to run away/to escape
to run away/to flee in disarray
to run away/to take to one's heels
to flee in disorder/to scurry off
(of a plot etc) to fall through and stand exposed
see 一哄而散[yi1 hong1 er2 san4]
variant of 倉皇|仓皇[cang1 huang2]
